name: Type Dreams
description:
"To save time is to lengthen life."
- Motto of The Remington Typewriter Company (1892)

Choose from panoply of tools, exercises, and stats to speed your ascent into
TYPING MASTERY.

Soon, you'll be racing the fastest qwerticians ever to touch the home row,
each depicted in utmost fidelity with regards to their prowess on the keys:
Mary E. Orr, for example, only used 4 fingers on her blind Remington 2.
Michael Shestov is almost certain to win if numbers are in the text.
Barbara Blackburn, on her custom Dvorak, outlasts rivals across any marathon.

More than 50 historical and contemporary typists are ready to challenge you.

Everybody learns differently, so Type Dreams incorporates
a variety of text styles to suit your individual sensibilities.
Some find this game's rhythmic sessions of songs/lyrics are
the best way of carving an up-sloping growth curve to their
typing ability, while others benefit more from focused reps of
key training exercises. Pick from modern or classic poetry,
informal conversations / correspondence, news articles, smut,
and, uhh, more.

Will you uncover any secrets along the way?
